Abstract: Based on the calculated correlation between hydrometeorological characteristics and helio- and geophysical parameters (solar activity and the Earth rotation velocity), forecast of the ecosystem state is given for some fishing areas of the World Ocean (North Western Atlantic, Central Eastern Atlantic, South Eastern Atlantic, West-Indian Ridge) for 2015. Both atmospheric characteristics (surface atmospheric features: pressure and its gradients, atmospheric transfers and their vorticity) and hydrological ones (ice field sizes, upwelling intensity, front locations, ocean surface temperature) were forecast under correlation with confidence probability 95 % and 99 %.; \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd <id>http://10.0.0.196:8080/jspui/handle/1/1913</id>     <updated>2014-07-22T08:54:41Z</updated>     <published>2014-01-01T00:00:00Z</published>     <summary type="text">Title: Hydrophysical conditions, the total suspended matter field and biological pollution estimation of the Kerch Strait waters in September 2011 following Ukrainian-Russian expedition Authors: Lomakin, P.D.; Trotsenko, B.G.; Chepyzhenko, A.I.; Chepyzhenko, A.A. Abstract: Based on the data of the complex Ukrainian-Russian oceanological expedition, carried out on September 26-29, 2011, water circulation, fields of the main hydrophysical elements, total suspended matter and dissolved organic matter (DOM) in the Kerch Strait are analyzed. As a result, a complex of hydrophysical, hydrooptical, hydrochemical and hydrobiological parameters of the water ambience was investigated. The regularities of the considered fields\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd structure in conditions of weak-wind weather are revealed. Biological pollution of the water is estimated. It is marked that in the waters, close to the main objects of economic activities, the inverse correlation dependency between salinity and DOM content with the coefficient ranging from -0.60 to -0.76 is revealed, which means that DOM of artificial origin is transported into the strait waters with the numerous freshwater sewers, including the household and the industrial ones.; maxima maeotica (Pallas) in Ukrainian waters of the Black Sea Authors: Shlyakhov, V.A. Abstract: Based on the YugNIRO research, biological and fishing information is given, including estimates of the IUU catch of turbot Psetta maxima maeotica (Pallas) in the Ukrainian sector of the Black Sea in 1997 2013. Catch statistics, population parameters, natural mortality rate and length composition for the Eastern and Western Ukrainian waters separately were used for the turbot stock assessment by the LCA and short-term forecasts for the North-Eastern and Western stocks.
